comment: He is a really good professor if you go to his class and read before the quiz then you will do really good in his class.

Complete waste of time in class. He would complain when we didn't come to a non-mandatory class and then talk about material we've already taken a quiz on. A chapter each week. Uploads multiple two-hour long lectures you have to listen to for some quiz questions. No lockdown quizzes, but midterm and final in-person. 85% was old quiz questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: BEST PROFESSOR EVER!!!

He's very knowledgeable in his area, New England slavery.  However, you need to do the work on your own to learn what's asked on the exams.  Overall, we read about 450+ pages of text for two tests and wrote 4, one-page papers on our thoughts of the chapters we read.  An A is possible as tests were curved due to the difficulty.  Good luck!

Dr. Desrochers was pretty straight forward.  5 tests make up all of your grade. First test was pretty tough, but the rest follow the same pattern. If you want  an A: 1) Read each chapter twice. 2) Use the online quizzes and flash cards provided by the book. 3) Know each chapter well. Fun class/ hilarious professor. DO NOT TAKE IF YOU'RE A SLACKER!

I attended most lectures and did the reading, got an A on every test. Tests are multiple choice, mostly taken from readings, but some questions from Powerpoints in class. Relates own experiences to lectures. Made material interesting.

He's very funny and makes the material easy to comprehend. I would take him again. It's an easy class. Just read and remember what you read and you'll be good for the tests. Also, Use wwnorton website He will advise you to use it as well, Use it! good resource. Chapter outlines, practice quizzes, etc.

I loved this class! Professor Desrochers lectures are interesting and he is very clear on what the test material is over. In order to do well on the test you have to read the chapters, but he also puts his lecture slides on D2L. Only 5 tests and the final is not cumulative.

Solid teacher, the class is pretty much straight lectures which wasn't so bad, he makes it interesting. The only graded things in the class were 5 exams. The exams are somewhat difficult but he gives a curve that helps you A LOT. He also will help you if you need it. Take him, if you can.

Loved good 'ol Rob. He is very very intelligent and knows a ton about the content taught in the class. While that is true, the test can be slightly difficult because they are so specific, but you shouldn't have problem if you look at online outlines and read the chapters. He is really funny too, but can be long winded. Really enjoyed it though.

Most straightforward teacher I've had in all my years of schooling. Syllabus is crystal clear, only graded material is 5 exams. I've hardly attended class and my grade is sitting at an 86 with two exams left. Book recommended; it's used in class for discussions, but studying can be done on the publisher's website for free (no access code needed)

He is definitely a well educated and respectable guy who knows his stuff. Classes mainly consist of lectures and going through power point slides, but he tends to get off topic. If you go to class, take notes, and read all of the material assigned (which can be a lot) you will do well. Easy B, but youll have to work for an A.

Great lectures! Show him respect and he will give it to you. Don't leave, sleep. or play on your phone in his class. Textbooks are a must. His lectures are usually over what is in the book. However, I recommend keeping up with readings if you want to get an a. Show up listen, take notes, and read you will do fine. Great guy and great class.

He's very passionate about what he does. However he starts class early and often lectures up to ten minutes past time, while blocking the door so no one can leave. He rarely finishes covering all the material before the tests and simply sends his PowerPoint's out for students to learn on their own. Its a bigger hassle than its worth.

Go to lecture, take some notes, and read the 150+ pages for each test. Easy B in the class, but you need to work to get an A.  I found his lectures interesting, however, he sometimes gets sidetracked on the material. I'd recommend him

Had a crazy semester with another professor and he took over our class halfway through. His lectures were really interesting for me and I felt really connected with the material. He was tough to approach after class though. He has a couple of classes with 200+ students and easily frustrated. His tests are super hard, you've got to study EVERYTHING!

Professor Desrochers is clearly a great guy who is trying to get his students interested in history. Very sarcastic and clever. Talks about important topics. However, his lectures tend to veer off into directions other than the book material, which means you have to read everything. Not a bad thing, but more work than many will expect.

This professor isn't too bad. His tests are TOUGH. There are 5 options, and I promise you, every option sounds right. You must read, or you're going to fail. If you want an A go to class, and read. He's an awesome guy who's passionate about history but he's also seems very biased.

Professor is inspiring & excited about history! Foner book is like reading death. After the Fact is an amazing read. Read the books! Do the study sessions on the Foner website! Expect his test to be HARD! Obscure Q's With all the right answers but you have to pick the most right one! He using AP grading for his tests because so many fail.

Professor Desrochers really knows what he's talking about and his lectures are interesting and hilarious. This class involves a ton of reading but if you like history it's not bad. Class was awesome cause we only had 5 tests, no papers or projects. Tests aren't very easy but even if you don't read but show up to every class you'll get a B.
